question: 東京
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>East</kanji> <kanji>Capital</kanji> in Japan is <vocabulary>Tokyo</vocabulary>. If you look on a map and compare it to <ja>京都</ja> (Kyoto, the other capital in history), you'll see it's East of Kyoto, making it the East Capital, Tokyo.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
